title: Sr. Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA)
Interview Descriptions: the interview is a panel format. the questions are open ended so that the candidate can demonstrate listening and asking clarifying questions. the process feels very fair. the atmosphere feels very positive and welcoming
Interview Questions: Explain the differences between/ benefits of waterfall versus agile

title: Public Funding Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (New Haven, CT) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Once my application was selected by the recruiter, I was invited to an initial 30min phone interview. About three weeks later, I was invited to a virtual interview with three individuals from the local TNC chapter for an hour long interview. There was a chance for a third interview, but I was not selected to proceed.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the organization? Why are you leaving your current position/how long have you been looking? What do you know about the role/what questions do you have? Describe your experience with conservation projects/initiatives. What grant writing experience do you have? What fundraising experience do you have? What experience do you have networking with other agencies/municipalities/organizations? Describe a time you disagreed with a coworker, how did you resolve it?

title: Finance Director - MN, ND, SD Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Minneapolis, MN) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Was recruited for the position. There was no response for a couple of weeks before they scheduled a phone screen. This resulted in moving on to scheduling a panel interview. At the same time I was contacted to schedule a phone interview and the panel interview was cancelled.  At the scheduled time there was no call. Reached out to the person who had scheduled me who said they would look into it but they never got back to me.
Interview Questions: They ghosted the interview entirely.

title: Grants Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: The recruiting and interview processes were seamless and positive, with excellent communication from TNC all throughout. I was asked to complete a questionnaire and then invited to an interview. The questions felt reasonable for the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for TNC?

title: Associate Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I was excited to interview with The Nature Conservancy because they have such a great reputation of doing impactful work and treating their employees well. I had a basic screening via Zoom. The interviewer asked very standard questions, like he was checking them off a list. Fine but not really engaging. I haven't heard a single thing in several weeks so I guess they decided not to move on without me in the process. Also fine, but extremely rude not to let people know. It takes a few seconds to email people you reject - common courtesy and not excuse not to do it.
Interview Questions: Are you okay with the salary range for this position?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for the questionnaire but I did not move forward in the process. The hiring team was personable and kind when delivering the news that I didn't get the position.
Interview Questions: In the questionnaire they ask about how you define diversity and how you have applied it in your job experience.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Rounds of interviews, work submissions, writing sample. I was interviewed by two potential managers. The process was thorough and longer than expected. Email to follow up and express interest! Very amazing people at TNC!
Interview Questions: How do you see this internship fitting in with larger career goals ?

title: Loyal Donor Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Good face time with multiple levels of the company, from direct manager, to teammates, to other teams. Process was spread over a month and each interview was at least an hour
Interview Questions: What does diversity mean to you?

title: Sr. Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (New York, NY) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Had a call with the hiring manager to discuss work history and the position. Then a panel interview with the same hiring manager and 2 developers in similar positions. They asked a variety of database, API, and frontend web development questions.
Interview Questions: What is an api? Result of Select * from table_1 Result of JOIN on 2 tables by an id, including when one id is null What is a React hook?

title: Applied Scientist II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: The process went fairly smoothly. Several members of the team reached out and scheduled interviews. In each interview, asked several questions, and then time was left for me to ask questions at the end.
Interview Questions: What makes you the best candidate for this job?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Brussels) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: le processus de l entretien s est passee virtuellement via Teams, tres humain, les personnes de l organisation avaient une energie positive et etait tres gentils... Les questions posees etaient en relation avec le travail, rien de travers, beaucoup de respect
Interview Questions: entretien c est tres bien passe

title: Senior Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for a job at Nature Conservancy and was interviewed by the hiring manager. I was impressed with the company's mission and the positive impact it has on the world. However, during the interview, I faced some challenges. Firstly, the interviewer did not initially mentioned on what to expect or what we are going to discuss during the interview. Secondly, her explanation of the role was confusing and scattered. Lastly, it was not clear what the expected outcome of the role was, and it seemed like they just needed someone to fill the position temporarily. I didn't see any opportunities for future growth or advancement. There was a lack of clarity during the interview on the information shared.  Unfortunately, due to these factors, I had a negative experience as a candidate for the position at Nature Conservancy.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self?

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward. Started with a simple phone interview then followed by a panel interview with other staff members. Questions revolved around the position responsibilities, my interest in the organization, and diversity, equity and inclusion.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this role?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: TNC first asked me to fill out a questionnaire followed by a screening interview with a team member, and a panel interview with the team. The following interview was with the higher up, which I did not make it through to.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: This was what I call a "whoo boy". I got a very clear image of what working at TNC would be like. I applied in October (possibly September) and the first step was an 8-part questionnaire which I received in November. The second step was a 7-person panel interview scheduled a day or two before Thanksgiving. Most of the questions asked were repeats of questions from the questionnaire. At no point did this feel like my questionnaire had been read. This step was not a conversation: I would answer, try to engage, but the process moved on to the next rapid-fire question. Another month rolled by and I was invited to a second interview. This time with four people and in the same rapid-fire style. During both interviews, I was asked essentially the same questions in multiple ways: 1. How do you handle stressful, chaotic situations? 2. How do you deal with difficult people? Another month goes by and I get a request for references. At this point, I backed out because I could see what working with this group would be like. I asked the recruiting team multiple times for a salary range and received no response.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with ambiguity?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (New York, NY) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Fluent, two people were very welcoming, while the third one was quite challenging and very serious. It lasted one hour, it took place in a remote fashion. They did not answered my questions with concrete examples or situations. Perhaps, they were not a match for me!
Interview Questions: All related to the job

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth. The coordinator sent over a short questionnaire to fill out and send back. Once it was sent, I heard back to schedule an interview within a few days. The whole process was very efficient, organized and friendly. Everyone made things feel relaxed and comfortable. I went through two rounds of interviews. The first one was back to back days for about an hour. Then the next one a week or two later for an hour.
Interview Questions: How do you handle the monotony of repetitive tasks?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of two virtual (zoom) interviews with panel of staff who conducted the interviews. It was a slow process, took about four months from time of application to offer. Interviews were organized and well structured.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your background and prior experience.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: standard application and then a 3 part interview. First interview was with two individuals and interview three and four were each with a panel. I did not get the position but felt position about the experience and everyone I met with.
Interview Questions: To describe my experience resolving a conflict

title: Monitoring Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Nairobi) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: It is a comprehensive interview process with a panel keen to know if your skills match the position requirements. The first process is a pre-screening interview, task and then final stage
Interview Questions: What added value would you bring to the team?

title: Development Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Bogotá, Bogota) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Really the worst hiring process I've participated in, probably ever. I was emotionally manipulated and lied to from the beginning by the hiring manager who phoned me up on WhatsApp on the first day of the process to tell me how great she thought I would be for the role. After successfully completing 3 interviews and a technical test, her inappropriate phone calls telling me how much of a great organisational fit I was, and even in evening hours, continued. She even pushed me to negotiate my salary/conditions and told me that TNC would never reject me for doing that, and that I should empower myself to do so because for women this is something we find very difficult. After this, she requested 3 professional references from me which confirmed to me that they were contacted by her. After this process, I received what I believe was an informal offer from her by phone. As recommended by her, I tried to negotiate, but about holidays rather than salary as money wasn't my main motivation. I asked for some minimum holidays during the first year as Colombian labour law doesn't allow holidays in your first year of a job, and I understood that as an international org, they may be able to have some flexibility on this one. After this conversation, I could sense the hiring manager turning cold and becoming very strange with me. A few days later, I received a rejection email. I was honestly shocked and gobsmacked at the lack of professionalism and the inappropriateness that took place in the process. In total, it was around 2 months of my time wasted and really knocked my confidence. My faith in the international NGO sector has also been very damaged by this and is unlikely to recover any time soon.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for TNC? Why do you believe that strategic communications are important in the development of proposals? How do you project manage grant writing processes?

title: Equitable Energy Transition Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position in late October. I was invited to an initial screening interview in early December. The initial screening was with a peer in the department and was very friendly and casual. The following two interviews were panels with department managers. They asked me questions but also gave me plenty of opportunity to ask my own. Everyone was friendly. I definitely took the time and opportunity during my interviews to get a sense of management style, work styles, communication styles. Everyone was very open to sharing how they work. All interviews took place via Zoom.
Interview Questions: Initial interview questions were general, along the lines of "why do you want this position and why are you qualified?" Going further, the manager panel asked a lot of questions to gauge my comfort with the complex, matrixed organizational structure.

title: Human Rights Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Re. the Corporate Engagement Human Rights Analyst position. I provided TNC with a completed online form, a resume, and a cover letter. TNC contacted me for a 30-minute phone interview, asked me to complete a take-home exercise (a cover letter-type question), and then invited me to take part in x2 45-minute panel interviews. From the application’s submission to the first-panel interview: 71 days. - Panel 1 asked very generic interview questions, with little connection to the role. I was left with the impression that the panelists were unenthusiastic and cared little about the interview. - Panel 2 was far more engaged. Questions related to the role, professional experiences, and work challenges. The panelists were enthusiastic, asked deep and thoughtful questions, and were highly amicable. After the interview, it took TNC an additional 15 days to reject my candidacy (for context, it took less time for Apollo 11 to go to the moon and back, the Russian Army to mobilize in WW1, and for the Committee on Style and Arrangement to finalize the U.S. Constitution). Moreover, I was led to believe that TNC Human Resources would provide further updates on the application. Up to this point, TNC’s HR had been extremely courteous and professional. However, and to my confusion, Panel 1 got back and provided the now somewhat cliché rejection message, “…While your background and experiences were interesting and impressive, after much deliberation we have decided to move forward with another candidate.” I acknowledged the message and asked for feedback. TNC provided the following out-of-office: “Happy Holidays! I am out of the office until the end of the year, and will not be checking email. Thank you for your understanding.” Happy Holidays indeed! TNC commits to making the process “a positive experience.” However, the 15 days TNC took to communicate and reject my candidacy, the internal confusion over follow-up, and the generic, flippant even, manner TNC gave me their decision made this far from a positive experience. The public holds NGOs like TNC to a higher standard. NGOs must endeavor to ensure their approach to recruitment is considerate, especially for candidates that battle through a lengthy recruitment process. Remedy is straightforward: 1) Remind hiring managers that unsuitable candidates need timely rejections. 2) Encourage hiring managers to provide feedback, especially if the process is long and laborious. 3) Ensure that company hiring managers and Human Resources are communicating. 4) Discourage hiring managers from sending rejections while on Holiday Leave. It is unprofessional and inconsiderate. (It also makes you wonder why TNC is instructing their hiring managers to communicate rejections on leave). I am utterly soured by this experience and believe it may show some inner organizational dysfunction. Time is precious, and I am left with the feeling that TNC was comfortable wasting my time. Time put into the application, take-home exercise, phone calls, interview prep., and follow-up emails could have been better spent elsewhere. For prospective candidates, I hope the above is informative and enables you to consider whether you wish to go through such a process in your search for a conservation career. For TNC, I hope the above account contributes to the broader discussion on hiring practices and ethical recruitment at TNC.
Interview Questions: How does your manager describe you?

title: Finance Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Sacramento, CA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: While interviewing for a different position at TNC, a TNC recruiter recruited me for this job. I applied on a Tuesday and was invited to do an initial interview that Thursday. TNC moved very quickly. At every step of the process a clear timeline of the next steps was given. I did a total of 5 hours of interviewing for this position, which for what is basically an entry level position, felt excessive. One day I had three hours straight of interviews and I felt that could have been a panel as opposed to individual interviews.
Interview Questions: Coming from a very small non-profit, they asked a lot of questions about my ability to adapt and work at large organization.

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (New York, NY) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews over 2 months long drawn process The interviewers were not aware of the key expectations from the role Got back after 3 months on a follow up mail, that they did not find me fit
Interview Questions: What has been your experience of working with standards?

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Had one online interview with the supervisor and he followed with a small task to be completed (similar to the project of the position). After returning the task, had a follow up call and email about 5 days later with an offer.
Interview Questions: What is one challenge that you think you could have in this project/position and how would you solve it?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Boston, MA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was an initial phone screen. The recruiter was friendly and the questions were basic. She did a good job of describing the position and described the process well including next steps. Good impression of their HR staff so far. Hoping to hear back.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your current position and why you are applying to this job

title: Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and heard back a month later, filled out a questionnaire, virtual 30 minute screening interview with HR, virtual panel interview with team members. About a week between each step and everyone was very communicative and direct.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with diverse sets of people?

title: Groundwater Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was on Zoom. I have enough time to talk about my background and experience. The question was related to the job and my background. I could able to cover most of the questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Why did you apply for this position? Are you able to lead a scientific project?

title: Project Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: two interviews, first with direct manager and in second and last stage of the process the a panel with two directors. Very straight foward questions, they ask about my previous experience and how I handle problems
Interview Questions: whats is my brain process to get from A to B

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: The first round was a a zoom call with 2 people, then another zoom call with 2 people and the final round was a 3 person zoom call. Prior to the last call, I had to complete provide feedback for how I would improve a blog post based on a scientific study. Overall, the interview process was to be expected.
Interview Questions: How would you organize your time with a lot of people asking for various things from you with different deadlines?

title: Communications & Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Took about 4 months to the final round. Little and slow feedback from the hiring team through most of the process. A rush at the final stretch. Various interviews with the hiring manager, a panel with peers and HR.
Interview Questions: Sharing experience on various methods of fundraising.

title: Climate Justice Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Had several rounds: HR, written test and panel interview. Then got ghosted for 3 months only to be told I was rejected (with no reasons given). The next day they re-advertised the position and have been promoting it for another two months. To give context the posting was *urgent* and I was told they wanted somebody to start immediately.
Interview Questions: How would you resolve conflict with a co-worker?

title: Program Manager, the Agility Lab Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA)
Interview Descriptions: I had a no-show twice before finally the 3rd time she showed up. It was barely a coherent conversation before I was told 1 week later that other applicants with more experience was chosen. Not a fair assessment if you ask me given I had a 10 min conversation about very high level logistics of the role. It was a poor representation of this organization since she showed up extremely groggy and unprepared. I also noticed, the program managers are of similar age and experience to me so I was confused on the feedback. Nonprofits trying to be “agile” by using a bunch if buzzwords in their job decryption.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and background?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Although it took a while for them to get back to me, once the interview process started it was very smooth. They required I do a case study and present at the interview to a panel of people who then asked me questions on my plan. They were not easy questions.
Interview Questions: They gave me a case study, I had to prepare a presentation, and then answer questions on my plan.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: GHOSTED. Did a project for them, had a one on one interview with the hiring manager, then put through a grueling panel interview with 4 others. Was completely ghosted after that. Followed up for SEVERAL weeks after and never heard anything. So rude and inconsiderate of the hours I spent preparing for the interviews/doing the project.
Interview Questions: Experience directly related to the role, how I analyze data, behavioral based questions.

title: Director of Marketing and Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Anchorage, AK) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview and application process was pretty standard and efficient. I applied through the online portal and about a month later, received a request to respond to several additional questions in writing. Of course I put a lot of thought into my answers but the questions themselves were not complex and it didn't seem designed to be onerous. I was called for an interview a week later, then had a second interview a week after that. a few days after the 2nd interview I had one more phone call with the chapter director and received an offer a few days later. All in all the process probably too two months, but once I started interviewing it was quick.
Interview Questions: There were a lot of questions like, "Tell me about a time when you ..." but they were not designed to be trick questions. They asked a lot of questions about my previous work experience, about campaigns I admire, times when I've had to overcome biases, how I approach a project, etc.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process is very rigorous and they provide feedback at each stage.
The interviews currently are mostly virtual. The interviews are done by panelists that works within the departments where the positions are drawn from.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was nice and compact. It was difficult but reasonable. The interviewers were nice and the atmosphere was good. I was able to ask enough questions that I wanted and it was possible for the interview to look at how the organization seemed to be.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to the position?

title: Manager (Sustainability) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions:
The entire process took 3 weeks, from the time of submitting my application to accepting my offer. It went surprisingly fast yet slightly rigid.

One week after submitting my application, I received an email from the hiring team to complete a questionnaire (5 questions in essay form) asking about my interest and experience relevant to the job. The following day I was invited to take part in TWO interviews and submit 3 references (who were all called before the interviews).

Both interviews took place on the same day and within 4 days I received the news I was offered the job. 

The interview questions must certainly followed only a structured format and they did not deviate (I suppose to ensure fairness and equality among all interviewees). All questions were different from what I was asked on the questionnaire. 

I made sure to prepare for the interviews by preparing to answer why I wanted to work at the organization, how I work in a team and how my experience can help the organization using the STAR approach as best as possible.
Interview Questions:
Why this job and why TNC?
What achievement are you most proud of?
Character traits I like/dislike in a manager.
Situational questions about how I would approach a task in the role.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took only about 1 month total. I applied and then received a phone screening request only a few days later. I did the screening immediately, and was told the salary range and position description. I was asked basic yes/no questions about my ability to perform the described duties, basic eligibility questions, and why I would be a good fit for the position. At the end she told me she would forward my application to the hiring manager. About a week later I had a virtual panel interview with three people from the team. It was an hour long interview with each person rotating through questions. They asked only 5 questions, which all came directly from the job description. The atmosphere was friendly and informal, but professional. About 1-2 weeks later I received a formal offer. I went through one round of negotiations before accepting. Overall I really appreciated how quickly the process moved because I was interviewing somewhere else simultaneously and it took much longer. Here it felt like filling the position was a real priority.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself.
Talk about a time you had to interact with different cultures and/or work across different time zones.

title: Market Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview has two phases. The first phase is a 30-minute phone screening interview. The second phase is a one-hour panel interview. The process is transparent and has a human touch, making it relaxing. Both interviews were virtual.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in relation to this role?

title: Economist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: 30 min first round interview with Senior Economist to gauge background and interest. Hour-long second round interview with Lead Scientist and another panel member. Behavioral questions in a discussion-environment - the panel comprised very nice people who showed genuine interest. Third round asked for a writing exercise (2 behavioral questions to understand work approach, professional strengths/weaknesses). Next step was a reference evaluation. A week later, I was asked if I am authorized to work in the US and if I would require sponsorship in the future. Informed them that I have a 3-year work permit under STEM OPT. Waited another week, found out I was rejected, no reason given. Asked for feedback - was told it was due to “minor differences in skill sets”. Not sure how I made it to the final round, passed reference checks, was asked about employment authorization and was THEN rejected for unknown skill differences.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for TNC?

title: Director of Finance and Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Little Rock, AR) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very long and multiple panels, some on Zoom and some in person. Took almost three months to final round. Drove six hours to final in person session, which took half day of in person and panel questions. Covid also struck interviewer afterwards.
Interview Questions: Please review this example case and provide a written response. The case was four pages.

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: The experience was very easy and comfortable. The questions where not difficult and easy to answer. The interviewer asked the right questions for the position. The process was overall good.
Interview Questions: Tell us something  about yourself

title: Video Editing Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a board of three people who all introduced themselves and their roles. The interview itself was an hour-long process of some pretty soft questions. Very professional and kind people.
Interview Questions: What's something not on your resume that you'd like to talk about?

title: Director of Operations and Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Overall a very long process lasting 3 months:

-After the submission of the initial application,  3 weeks passed and I was requested to complete a questionnaire. 
-After questionnaire submission, two weeks passed and I had introductory phone calls with local and nationwide recruiters then after 2 weeks had a panel interview.    
-After 2 weeks had passed and I was requested to complete a detailed real-world assignment over a holiday weekend.  Which, in order to do a decent job, took a lot of time. 
-A week later I was informed that I did not get the position. 

While the process was exhausting, TNC did a decent job of being professional and keeping me up-to-date (even if to inform me that they were behind schedule).  The hiring process definitely has the opportunity to be streamlined to reduce applicant fatigue.  I don't think TNC truly realizes how much effort and energy the applicant puts forth to be a part of their team.  If they do, then they need to change their hiring process.
Interview Questions: Judging by the provided information, how would you interpret the overall financial health of the chapter?

title: Conservation Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Charlottesville, VA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Conducted via Zoom due to COVID.  Two rounds over about four weeks.  First was with local hiring manager and their team.  Second was broader with colleagues from around the business unit.  Offer letter was prepared promptly after their decision.  After decision and acceptance, HireRight background check took about two weeks.
Interview Questions: Prepared questions but interview was conversational.  Questions were on point for the job and I was easily able to work in my prepared remarks.  Fitting in to the TNC is highly important so it is critical to have an answer to "Why do you want to work here?"

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward questions (roughly 8-13). There were about 3 people on the interview panel and they gave really good responses after each question rather than just moving on to the next.
Interview Questions: How did you become interested in conservation?

title: Conservation Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: After submitting application materials, I first heard back after a few weeks. The hiring manager requested a written response to a few question prompts. The next phase was a brief phone interview with a few staff, asking pretty basic questions, and then finally an in person interview with four staff. The in-person interview was certainly the most difficult and took the most preparation, however, they made each phase pleasant, and the other interview questions included on Glassdoor helped quite a bit. I spent a long time preparing for each interview. Turnaround was a little slow but that is to be expected with TNC. I was offered the job within a couple weeks after the final interview.
Interview Questions: From my perspective, how can we best address climate change.

title: Government Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews - both on zoom. One was 30 minutes the next was about an hour. From the time I applied to when I was offered a position was about 3 months.
Interview Questions: My background, experience in the field

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: It was very great to meet a large number of the team during the second interview and assess how I might fit in. The questions were run of the mill.
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself in this role?

title: Especialista Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Entrevista por vídeo. Gostaram do meu perfil e currículo, porém não obtive resposta sobre a contratação. O salário e benefício não foram informados. Deveria haver o retorno para o candidato ter uma noção do seu desempenho durante a entrevista.
Interview Questions: Fale sobre a sua experiência e formação profissional

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I had a pleasant phone screen that I thought went well, however I was ghosted afterwards despite attempts to follow up. A simple yes or no email would have been the polite and professional response.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: GIS Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Nairobi) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Two main interviews. First a screening interview and then a panel interview with a wider team depending on what position you are applying for. Very professional individuals and the questioning will mainly be based around the job
Interview Questions: What success looks like for the position within two years

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I had a 30 minute screening call with a third-party recruiter, a panel interview with three staff members, and finally my references were checked. Throughout the process, communication was between me and the original recruiter.
Interview Questions: How do you communicate with and track down staff members and partners from across the globe?

title: Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (London, England) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: First had a phone screening interview that lasted thirty minutes followed by a 1 hour panel interview all via zoom. This was followed by a skills assessment test. There were behavioral and skill specific questions. The interviews were good and professional and quite conversational in nature, so that eased pre-interview tension. No communication was made after the final skills test (more than a week elapsed) and that sucked because the initial process for the first two interviews and final assessment had consistent communication.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for TNC?

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Multi-step process, 15-20 minutes interviews with different team members. Very friendly interviewers, transparent process, no tricky questions. When one was prepared, it was easy to answer. Was a good interview overall.
Interview Questions: Common questions: tell me about your experience working this such ans such work component.

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with HR manager. Lasted between 30 to 40 minutes. Was asked questions about the assignment I completed the week prior to the interview (essay responses to 4 questions) and why I wanted the position. Interview was virtual.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Hidrólogo Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Mexicali) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Pasé por dos entrevistas antes de que me notificaran que había sido seleccionado para el cargo. En la primera entrevista, los entrevistadores investigaron acerca de mi experiencia general en las responsabilidades del cargo al que aspiraba. En la segunda entrevista, las preguntas fueron más específicas, pidiéndome que explicara cómo atendería situaciones hipotéticas.
Interview Questions:
* ¿Qué experiencia tienes en la coordinación de grupos de trabajo multidisciplinarios para actividades de conservación ambiental?

* ¿Qué experiencia tienes en proyectos de hidrogeología?

* ¿Qué tipo de variables de conservación has manejado?

* ¿Cómo manejas tu tiempo de trabajo?

* ¿Cómo asignas prioridades en el trabajo?

* ¿Qué experiencia tienes abordando proyectos y temas para los que no cuentas con experiencia o conocimiento previo?

* Háblanos de una experiencia (buena o mala) que te haya impactado en tu vida laboral.

* ¿Cuál dirías que es tu mayor debilidad?

* ¿Qué crees que necesitas aprender para desempeñar un buen papel en este cargo?

title: Donor Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: So far, my experience with The Nature Conservancy has been great!! I have enjoyed meeting all of the wonderful people, going through the interview process, and getting onboarded with the team. It is such an awesome organization, and I can't wait to keep growing with them.
Interview Questions: My own experience in fundraising.

title: Media Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included an initial interview with Human Resources, a panel interview with four people, and a final interview with the hiring manager for the role. All interviews took place over Zoom.
Interview Questions: What would success in this role look like to you?

title: Analista Pleno Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (São Paulo, São Paulo) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: A entrevista durou um mês no total. Depois que meu Cv estava na base de dados eles mandaram um e-mail dizendo que gostaram do meu Cv e que era pra eu responder 5 perguntas sobre a área e minhas experiências. Depois de uma semana e pouco eles responderam o meu e-mail e me chamaram para um entrevista de painel (3 pessoas). Eles têm um script ja montado e conversam antes da entrevista para dizer quem vai fazer qual pergunta. Foi uma hora de perguntas, muitas sobre situações de meus trabalhos anteriores e como eu lidaria com situações no trabalho. Entrevista toda em inglês e um deles era nativo (estados unidos). Elxs são muitos educadxs e super explicam sobre a vaga, a TCNC, falam sobre si mesmos, etc. Depois dessa entrevista, elxs me reponderam em 1 semana  e fizeram uma proposta e eu aceitei.
Interview Questions:
As perguntas são:

1. sobre sua visão sobre a TNC
2. são para entender a sua personalidade./perfil psicológico
3. para entender como você se encaixa na TNC
4. para que vc entenda do trabalho  e como funciona o trabalho.
5. Eles fazem perguntas tio: Se vc tivesse tal problema e o que vc faria?
6.

title: Geospatial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, TX) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Algumas perguntas básicas sobre quais foram minhas experiência profissionais passadas , quais habilidade (hard skills), quais softwares que uso etc. Quais os meus pontos fracos, os meus pontos Fortes etc.
Interview Questions: Quais softwares uso, quais tipos de análises tenho mais habilidades, quais meus pontos frasco

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and about a month later was sent a questionnaire to fill out and submit. A week later I had a 30 minute phone screen with a recruiter to go over my background and experience. I was then moved on to the next stage where I had a video call with 2 people from the department that lasted about 45 minutes. They asked questions very similar to what was on the questionnaire but a little more in depth. I was told a few days later they were moving forward with other candidates with more direct experience. 

The recruiter was incredibly transparent, kept me up to date and informed me of any updates as soon as she knew, and was so nice to work with. Although I didn't get the job, every person I met with was incredibly nice and respectful.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time where you handled a difficult situation

title: Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: First a screening call with a few questions. The next step was an interview with a panel of people, and then possibly a third interview, although I did not get that far.
Interview Questions: Do you work better in a team or on your own?

title: Visual Content Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: They were very communicative throughout the quick, multi-step process and while I didn't get the position I was comfortable knowing that they had gotten a solid understanding of my skills, knowledge and personality.
Interview Questions: How do you respond to feedback and criticism?

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute interview with 2 staff members and then a 45 minute interview with 3 staff members a week later. They checked my references but I did not receive an offer.
Interview Questions: Describe experience you have with outdoor work.

title: Prospect Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: I completed a phone screen with an HR person, heard back the next business day requesting a panel interview, and then later that week had the interview over zoom. The following week, I got a personal phone call letting me know I wasn't selected.
Interview Questions: They asked me to describe a typical work day and how many units/departments/gift officers I support.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Received an email about 6-8 weeks after application.  A zoom interview for 30 min with the project leader and program supervisor.  They will interview others and have a finalist pool for the second round interview
Interview Questions:
Q: Why TNC
Q:  What do you look for in an employer
Q:  What are the challenges you see in this particular project
Q: Why you are a good fit for this position
Q: Any Questions for us

title: East Africa Forestry Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Africa, MO) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Was generally smooth with screening interview followed by panel interview. The panel interview was initially supposed to be comprised of 5 panelists but ended up with 4 from different countries.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best candidate and would you approach the job if successful.

title: Reporting and Technical Accounting Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and heard back about an interview about 2 weeks later. There was a phone screening followed by 2 rounds of video interviews. First round was two panel interviews, each with 2 TNC people.  Second round was two one-on-one interviews.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to handle a situation delicately and how it went.

title: Agriculture & Climate Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a 30 minute "screening" interview. I was expecting behavioral questions, but the questions were more technical and job-specific.  The second interview was 45 minutes and consisted of a 10 minute presentation (for which I had a week to prepare), 5 minutes of Q&A, 20 minutes of resume and situational questions, then 10 minutes for me to ask questions. The questions were tough but thought-provoking.
Interview Questions:
If you witnessed a microaggression in a meeting, how would you respond?
What is your preferred program/software for this type of work? 
What do you think of XX science topic?

title: Investment Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got a first-round interview. Thought the interview went well as it went more like an informal conservation, but guess I was wrong because I didn't move on.
Interview Questions: what drove you to apply to the nature conservancy?

title: Coastal Adaptation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Houston, TX) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews, each of the interviews were with two people (project manager and someone from HR I believe), both of them were behavioral. They asked questions about qualifications, situation questions and about reasons for interest in the job
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you acted as a leader

title: Innovation Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Even though I didn't get passed the initial screening, I heard directly from the team and they were helpful and considerate. The Director offered me feedback on my CV and submitted project.
Interview Questions: To submit a recent project I had completed.

title: Legacy Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Went through 2 interviews, one brief interview and a second more elaborate interview. It was pretty straightforward.  The interviewer was very respectful and there were 2 people interviewing me the second time
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Enterprise Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Ciudad de Mexico) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Standard. I had a technical written test before. It was a panel interview composed of 4 people from different departments. Several questions related to how my experience matched the position requirements.
Interview Questions: How does your experience match the position?

title: Policy Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: A few weeks after the general application closed, I was given a slightly more detailed job description and asked to submit an additional paper on why I felt I was a good candidate for the position. I was then asked to do a 30-mintue phone interview, followed by a panel interview (via zoom). I was then asked for references.  I did not receive the first position, but was instead directed towards another one that also fit my background/qualifications. I went right into the panel-interview phase (again via zoom) and received an offer.
Interview Questions: How would you approach working with a team of people from diverse backgrounds?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted over the phone. The interviewer did not ask many technological questions, but asked why I want to join the organization. The entire interview was less than 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why I want to join the organization

title: Financial Analyst & Grants Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Sacramento, CA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screen with the hiring manager, followed by several one-on-one interviews with TNC staff that work with the role being filled. The final interview was a meeting with the department director. The whole process took about three weeks from the phone screen to accepting an offer.
Interview Questions: Several "describe a time when" questions.

title: Digital Content Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was very selective.  They require 3 interviews: one with the Hiring Manager, then a panel interview, and a final one with the Director of the area. The entire process took around 3 months.
Interview Questions: What strategic initiatives have you successfully implemented in your previous role?

title: Grant Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Very positive, with formal q and a, all managers involved in initial interview process. be sure to prepare regarding different initiatives in their portfolio. Included extensive written work and phone interview prior to in person interview.
Interview Questions: What is the most threatening thing to our planet, in your opinion? If a grant was managed in error, how would you correct that information to the funder?

title: External Affairs Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Fair interview process, very nice interviewers. Very factual and professional. No common HR questions about "Tell me about yourself" and "Why should we hire you". There were only job related questions and tasks to solve.
Interview Questions: Imagine you are in this job related situation. What do you do to achieve your goal.

title: Executive Operations Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had two rounds of interviews over zoom. Great questions, very upfront and honest about position and the needs they had for the organization. Great people. When I received my rejection email it was professional and personalized. I felt truly valued despite not receiving the offer. While I was disappointed, I did not feel my time had been wasted.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself, give examples of things relevant to the job description, what are your greatest strengths, and how would they translate to the position.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Verbal and written assessment was fairly easy. Nice interactions during interview process. Good benefits. Round table of questions to candidate from different staff members made it feel impersonal and less focused
Interview Questions: How would you report on a grant that had shifted directions?

title: Volunteer Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions:
1. Self-introduction, about three minutes
2. One-to-one questions & answers, about ten minutes
questions are related to your major, work experience, activities and hobbies
3. Project introduction, about five minutes
projects are related to the role of department
Interview Questions: Why you choose The Nature Conservancy?

title: Legal Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Process started with one short interview over the phone. The second interview was in-person and included a test. The test was short and included some basic skills questions. I also had to follow instructions and draft a letter.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths/weaknesses?

title: Internal Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough. After submitting my CV, I was sent a questionnaire with personal and job-specific questions. This was followed by a video conference call to discuss submitted answers and additional questions with 3 staff members.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at TNC and what interests you about this position?

title: Stewardship Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: All that was required was a resume and a cover letter. I did both, reached out a few times, and didn't hear back as to if I was going to be hired or not.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a Steward?

title: Government Affairs Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a roughly 30 minute phone interview with a member of the HR staff as part of the first round of the screening process. Very conversational in nature, centered mostly around previous work experience.
Interview Questions: What skills do you think you could bring to this position?

title: Grants Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Alexandria, VA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was conducted via two virtual interviews on Zoom with different members of the hiring team and my future supervisor, with additional communication before, after and between interviews via email.
Interview Questions: What is your learning style?

title: Marketing Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: After applying through their website I was asked to complete a questionnaire. After sending in my answers I quickly heard back from the manager. From there, I received a 30 minute phone interview.
Interview Questions: What have you learned when presenting data to colleagues? Tell me about your past experience. Give an example of a specific analysis presentation you gave.

title: Gift Planning Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions:
Standard interview process. 
Head of the team contacted me for a 30 minute long screening.  She explained the job and what the position entailed.  Then went on to ask me a couple of questions. Heard back after a 10 days.
Interview Questions: How do you handle doing mundane work?

title: Executive Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough process, included a questionnaire, screening interview, and then a 2-hour interview with higher ups. The questions in the thorough interview were complex and detailed. Definitely not for the faint of heart, but I think they really got a feel for their candidates. There may have also been a final interview with the top person.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the Nature Conservancy?

title: State Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Professional. Lengthy. Great Communication throughout. I did not get the job and want to work there. I was recruited, did a phone interview (informal), two group interviews, a one-one with the supervisor and an employee interview.
Interview Questions: They dove deep on motivations and real-word challenges of the role.   Other questions were not difficult but definitely pointed. You had to be able to identify your own weaknesses and prep for it.

title: Restoration Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed over Skype because I was located across the country from the position location.  The interviewer was very kind and open, which helped make me feel comfortable and welcomed.
Interview Questions: Why did I want this specific job?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I did not pass to the interview round, but one of the first filters is to complete a questionnaire with questions in a short-essay form. I had 2 days to complete it and send it.
Interview Questions: Some of the questions were on my interest in the position, the experience that would allow me to succeed in the organization and the position. There were other questions such as salary expectations and travel availability.

title: Email Production Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: After a 30-minute video interview, I was asked to complete an assignment by creating an email template by altering existing HTML code, inserting header image, and answering a series of questions. It's been 6 weeks since I submitted my answers, and I haven't heard back from anyone. I sent a follow up email, still nothing. I find it extremely unprofessional. If you are asking candidates to spend their time on assessments, you should at least have the courtesy to follow up.
Interview Questions: You know that you can only send one email to support the promotion of one petition this month. After reviewing each of the three petitions’ content on nature.org (see links above), which would you choose, and why? What tracking/sourcing elements would you suggest we put into place to track the performance of the campaign and the long-term value of member retention? How would you segment your audience(s) and what email messaging content would you send to each?

title: Policy Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: First round was very technical, with questions about specific policies and my knowledge and experience with them. Did some deep research on the content to prepare, but this was a technical interview where they didn't want to get to know you, but wanted to know what you know.
Interview Questions: What was a time you had to convince someone of something?

title: Laramie Foothills Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Boulder, CO) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: While I was nervous for the interview process, it was more like a conversation between two people. There were no curve balls with interview questions. After the interview I was notified in  a few days that I'd be starting the following Monday.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals and how does this position aid in you professional career?

title: Stewardship Field Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions about conservation experience.  Mainly focused on experiences with job duties (i.e. invasive species removal and conservation easement monitoring). Took about half an hour and heard back within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: What strategies and methods do you use for conservation easement monitoring?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Wonderful experience. The interview was done with several individuals sitting in on a zoom. They were all kind and asked reasonable questions. They all spoke about their own work and were informative about the position I was applying for.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with power tools before?

title: HR Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: 12 interviews over the course of 2 months (some virtual and some in person). Thoughtful case studies at each interview so I felt like I was getting good intel on the job I was coming into through the interview process. Communication back to me as a candidate was timely.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have leading diversity and inclusion efforts?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I sent a cover letter and CV, and was contacted for a first interview by Skype, which was very professional and friendly. I had a second interview in-person, and was advised one week later that I had been selected. The full process (form sending CV to receiving offer letter) took 4 months.
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself in 5 years? What do you know about TNC? What do you think are the best qualities needed for your position?

title: Finance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Lima, Lima Region) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Got an email with basic screening questions related with the role and also motivations about climate change and non-profits. Then interview with manager with classic questions, then a financial case explaining how a donation was going to be used (here they wanted to see how easily I understood the industry and also excel skills for presentation and minimize iterations). Presentation  of case to a panel. All of the interviewers were very nice, it was like talking in a business school. Everything was online, and it was before the pandemic. I got the job, and we are doing everything online now.
Interview Questions:
Motivations for non-profits
Related past experiences that matches job description

title: External Affairs Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and about two months later got asked to do a phone interview. About a week after that I heard back to come in for an in-person interview with five people. Really nice and welcoming people, interview went well, but took them a long time to get back to me saying they were moving ahead with someone else
Interview Questions: Asked about the importance of geospatial data in relation to policy work, if I've used more external or internal data systems in my past roles, how I stay organized and on top of multiple deadlines, etc.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application, participated in a 30 minute phone screen, answered 5 short essay questions, participated in a 1.5 hour in-person interview with 6 people on the interview panel, participated in a 30 minute interview with a Board member, participated in follow-up interviews with 4 staff, and then received an offer.
Interview Questions: Customized scenario questions based on my position. Also asked "What is something new that you've done recently?"

title: Water Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview at TNC offices in bogotá. I was interviewed by the staff of TNC. (3 in total). The interview was in Spanish and English. They asked me for my professional experiences and how to solve problems related with the job vacancy
Interview Questions: Tell me about your professional experience and how it matches with this vacancy

title: Foundation Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Brunswick, ME)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted about a week after the application deadline to schedule a phone screening. This was followed by an 90-minute in-person panel interview and then a less formal 1:1  meet and greet. The team requested my references shortly after the 1:1 and then extended an offer about 10 days later.
Interview Questions: How do you gain the trust of and collaborate with team members?

title: GIS Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Albany, NY) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Initial and second interviews were conducted virtually and began by discussing myself as a candidate, my background, and my interest in the Nature Conservancy. By the second virtual interview the outline/ duties of the position were discussed and was structured like a forum to get to know the position I would potentially fill, and to address any questions I had. By the in person interview It was essentially just checking knowledge of GIS processes and discussing ways in which I problem solved and troubleshot problems in the software in my own projects.
Interview Questions: What should you do if you are struggling (for example) with a function in GIS  that is slowing your work, and you are not finding a solution?

title: Water Quality Speicialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Auburn, NY) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: More interested in me as a person and my characteristics than reciting experiences from my resume. The interviewers were very nice but somewhat unclear as to position-specific tasks, which made interview somewhat more difficult.
Interview Questions: Toughest question: who are naysayers in relation to the position and how would you convince them to see the value in your work

title: GLOBE Summer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview - they asked character questions and gave example scenarios of dealing with interpersonal issues and asked how I would solve them. I was given an offer a couple of weeks later.
Interview Questions: What would you do in the following scenario: <something relating to interpersonal issues>

title: Engagement Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very long. Four months total.  I had one phone interview with a person from HR. It was about twenty minutes long and it was a positive experience. The person asked me questions about my event planning and meeting planning experience and my salary requirements.
Interview Questions: Can you describe your event planning experience?

title: Operations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and didn't hear anything for about a month before being offered an interview via email. First interview was with two supervisors and lasted about 45 minutes, and then about three days later I was offered a second interview with two different higher up people. This one lasted an hour and a half (forty five minutes over the allotted time!) and I thought it went great. About a week later I learned that I had not gotten the position
Interview Questions: What do you think the biggest learning curve would be?

title: Digital Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: After applying, I received a phone call one month later to set up a phone interview with the would be boss. Shortly after the phone call, I was invited for an in-person interview, which involved four people. Two weeks later, I received notice that I did not get the job and that is was a tough decision. The interviewees were all very nice.
Interview Questions: What is the best piece of feedback you've ever been given?

title: Especialista Financeiro Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (São Paulo, São Paulo)
Interview Descriptions: Entrevista com gerente e supervisor da área de finanças. Foram feitas apenas duas entrevistas e o processo todo durou poucas semanas. As entrevistas foram 1:1 ou via Skype. Não ocorreram testes ou provas de conhecimentos, nem atividades em grupo.
Interview Questions: Experiência prévia na área, como se sente ao trabalhar para um ong.

title: GeoDesign Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: The three interviewers asked simple questions about my GIS experience and relevant interests.  The asked about my experience with cartography, vector and raster analysis. It was fairly informal and quick.
Interview Questions: Explain your experience with raster and vector analysis.

title: Assistente Administrativo Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Brasília, Federal District) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: A entrevista é bem completa, de caráter qualificatório, exigindo também da pessoa uma boa redação. As perguntas são bem objetivas para o candidato, exigindo dela respostas claras, concretas e simples.
Interview Questions: O que faz você trocar de local de trabalho?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Two steps. First one is via Weixin. HR asked me about the educational background, technique experience, weekly availablity via if hired. The second interview was via phone call with a group of candidates, competences and etc.
Interview Questions: Questions were about self-introduction,  why we should hire you? What you can bring to our team?

title: Long Island Sound Program Coordinator (Can't Remember Exact Title) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: First I received a phone screening then an in person interview. There were three people conducting the interview (this may not always be the case but this particular job had a grant). They were all very friendly.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been in a situation where you are talking to people who disagree with you?

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Washington, DC) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Really good interview experience, first a phone interview and then on site to meet the team, finally meet with the director. The whole interview process runs very smooth, they always have the instruction about next step and response my email in time. What impressed me was before the onsite interview, they emailed me about the interview panel info with the bio of each one of them, that was very helpful.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for TNC

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with hiring manager and in-person interview with three people. She gave me an assignment a few days before the interview. Overall it was a slow but decent process. Would have appreciated more time to complete the exercise.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Shanghai, Shanghai) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I sent my resume via email. Then I was contacted by HR in Beijing to schedule a phone interview though I applied for a position in Shanghai. The audio interview was conducted by two people and lasted for about 30 mins. I was approaved on the phone and asked to go to the office for further explanation.
Interview Questions: What knowledge do you think you can apply to our work?

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online towards the end of their application window and heard back within 10 days to participate in a video interview. The video interview was pretty standard, just describing the position in more detail and how it fit within the company overall. I interviewed with what would have been my team lead and she gave a very good description of her team and qualities she was looking for in the new hire. The interview questions were pretty standard, and I felt she was just trying to tease out personality and overall skills. 

I was then invited for a second in person interview at their office with about 5 other employees. The second interview was much more challenging from my perspective, it lasted about an hour and the questions were much more tailored towards the position which was heavy in communication and excel use. I honestly could not have prepared in advance for the second interview because the questions were SO specific (describe a time you pulled a report using excel, and describe specifically what functions within excel you used). The interviewers were all nice and respectful, and left some time for other follow up questions within the interview so it wasn't extremely rigid. While I felt like I fit the position I believe I lacked sufficient Excel experience and that was a deciding factor in me not getting a job offer. Overall the interview process was a little long and drawn out, but I never had a negative experience.
Interview Questions: What are three things you would bring to this team?

title: Grantmaking Initiatives Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2019
