Interview Descriptions: After the cover letter and resume, I was invited to submit both a writing sample relevant to the role as well as three pages of narrative responses to five questions.  Then, a video conference first interview, an in-person second interview and a final informal phone conversation with the hiring manager.  Then, references were checked and an offer was made.
Interview Questions: Describe what you're looking for in an ideal team member?  How would you rate yourself on the attributes you consider important?

title: Associate Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Fairly standard hiring process. Initial screening call; call with potential manager; and in-person interview with leadership and other members of the team. Straightforward questions. TNC is a large, complex organization and had lots of questions about how one would navigate the complexity.
Interview Questions: How would you navigate a large, complex organization?

title: Seasonal Conservation Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Cape May, NJ) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Informal, casual discussion style of interview in person. Looking to see a balance of interest and knowledge in wildlife conservation along with hands on experience with tools, equipment, etc. They look for fit over qualification.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have with power tools, machinery, etc.?

title: Associate Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online through their website and heard back via email in about a week. The HR rep scheduled a phone interview for which I was to call them at a prescribed time. I called for the interview and got a voicemail. After a second attempt I sent an email to make sure I had the right number. About 4 hours later the HR rep requested we reschedule as something had come up. We connected the next day and spoke for about 30 minutes. Basic phone interview type questions. I was told I could expect next steps in the next week. After 7 days I emailed to inquire on status. No response. About 2 weeks after the phone interview I got an email letting me know they are moving forward with other candidates. 

Fine experience while really rough on the communication. Would have liked to have moved on or gotten some feedback on what they were looking for.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for The Nature Conservancy?

title: Climate Change Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: One interview was over Skype video chat and the other interview was a multiple hour in person lunch at a local restaurant with three employees asking questions. Questions were directly related to the work that I would be doing and how I handle multiple job aspects
Interview Questions: What ifs...

title: Graduate Field Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Nairobi) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I believe the process was very thorough and fair. All applicants have an equal and fair chance in getting hired. The interview process was actually on very friendly and calm grounds, unlike some where the panel appear stiff, unwelcoming and a little judgmental.
Interview Questions: If you encountered a farmer with a farm that has a steep gradient or slope,what would you advise him or her?

title: Outreach Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and 3 weeks later received an email to begin the interview process. It was 3 interview in total. One on the phone with the hiring manager and 2 in person with  different team members.
Interview Questions:
Many questions were specific to the job description. Read up on the job description and see how it matches your skills and experience before the interview.
Other common questions:
Why do you want to work for TNC? 
What do you look for in team members (traits)?
Do you prefer to work in a team or individually?
How did you handle a difficult situation?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a cover letter and resume.  Got an email back about 2 weeks later to schedule an interview.  The interview was done over the phone.  It lasted about 30 minutes.  I received another email a couple months later saying that I wasn’t the finalist for the position.
Interview Questions: Some were traditional, like how do you organize yourself?  Others were more unique, such as if you could take a trip anywhere, where would you go?  Where is your favorite place?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very simple and nice. No hard questions were asked it was super casual. The interviewer was very kind and asked basic questions. Super easy. Nothing else really to talk about it was simple and straight forward.
Interview Questions: What do you wanna gain from this experience?

title: Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Hailey, ID) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied from posting at Indeed. Got called for a 30-minute phone interview and then a 1-hour in-person interview with a panel of 4 people. The panel asked a lot of questions about my background and specific skills that would be utilized in the new job.
Interview Questions: Was I familiar with Excel and if so, what did I like most about Excel.

title: Climate Change Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
It was fairly long with a lot of steps.  First was a skype interview with the hiring managers, then an in-person series of interviews with team members.

The hiring manager was wonderful at keeping me informed throughout the process and although they asked some challenging questions, the team was very nice.
Interview Questions: How would you spend the first 30/60/90 days on the job?

title: Urban Conservation Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Was contacted 4+ weeks later by HR who performed a salary screening and asked a few basic questions. 2nd Interview: Phone interview with two employees. 3rd Interview: In-person interview with three employees who asked many of the same questions as in the 2nd interview. Did not make it to the 4th round interview.
Interview Questions: What would others say are you strengths and weaknesses?

title: Conservation Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Minneapolis, MN) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process involved an e-mail screen with two quick questions to confirm that I was ok with the hours and compensation of this position.  Three weeks later, I received an invitation for a 30-minute phone interview. The phone interview took place two days later. The interview consisted of questions about my work history and experiences as well as an explanation of the job. The person interviewing me was kind and happy to talk to me about this new position as well as what The Nature Conservancy organization does as a whole. Almost one month later, I received an e-mail explaining that I did not get the position. They explained that the reason it took so long was because of a very large pool of applicants.  

Almost a month after this, I received an e-mail from the person I did a phone interview with. She had run across a similar position that was posted for a different organization, and was thoughtful enough to let me know about it. That was a nice gesture!
Interview Questions: Can you describe one part of a previous or current job that you would rather not have to do?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial questionnaire to complete, then a phone screening. Then an "in person" panel interview that was completed virtually because I live elsewhere. The interview was long for a behavioral-only that did not include a presentation or case study. One-on-one behavioral interviews with five different people.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were proud of your work. What did you accomplish? What would have made the experience even better?

title: Manager of A New Initiative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: It went quickly, from the cover letter and CV to the interview - seems there was only one round.  Via a Skype like video tool I was interviewed by four people, sitting in three different countries (and me a fourth).  They were engaging and easy to speak to, knowledgeable about their field.  Some following of a script, but with enough detours to avoid a too-stilted conversation.  Be warned that loading your CV into their 'tool' is going to take a lot of your time though - it machine reads it and, in my case, messed it all up.  You did not have a choice!
Interview Questions: What values would you say you hold.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Nairobi) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was called after shortlisting to be informed and given a date for a phone screening, informed on what they expect and asked if everything was clear plus planned for the 1 on 1 interview.
Interview Questions: To describe my role as per my understanding

title: Urban Conservation Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position in August 2017 and was contacted for a phone interview in November. Two weeks after, I was contacted for an in-person interview. The interview went extremely well and the person who would have been my boss let me know that I made it to the second part of the interview. I interviewed with two other directors which was even more positive than the first. I left and sent a follow up email; no reply. Two weeks later I sent another email again thanking them and asking if they made a decision; no reply. 8 months later I sent a handwritten letter; no reply. Very discouraging and I wish there could have at least been some communication that I wasn’t chosen. Working at TNC in this position was my dream job and I wish they were more responsive!
Interview Questions: How do you manage your priorities?

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: First round was a 20-minute phone interview, within a few hours I was notified that I would advance to the next round. Second round was also a phone interview a few days later, but 45 minutes instead of 20. Was told third/final round of the process was an in-person interview with the CEO. Both interviewers were friendly and the conversation was great.
Interview Questions: What kind of communications strategies have you employed in your previous positions?

title: Conservation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through their portal. After two months, I received a phone interview invitation. After a few weeks I was called for an interview, which took place with five members of staff. After two weeks I got an offer and started working two weeks after that. Needless to say, the process was lengthy, but the people were really wonderful all throughout and I am really happy with the general outcome. It was definitely worth it!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for TNC?

title: Government Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions:
phone interview lasting about 30 min
it's more like a casual conversation about my past experiences and interests in environmental issues.  Since it was a position working with government agencies, I was also asked to describe my communication skills.
Interview Questions: do you have experience in meeting support?

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The first interview went very well - the team was extremely friendly and I felt like I made a genuine connection. I was brought on for a second/last interview and it had seemed completely different.  I don't know if it was a tactic but I did not feel like I was interviewing with the same people. All that aside, however, it was still a good experience.
Interview Questions: What was one of your biggest challenges during an event and how did you handle it?

title: Agricultural Program Specialist, AFRPS Auditor/Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: They were very flexible as I wasn't living in their town to do a phone interview. She asked pretty standard questions, however I didn't feel like we connected. Maybe because there was no face-to-face, or otherwise. Wish they had given more information about what the job would entail, I left the interview still not completely understanding.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for TNC?

title: Prescribed Fire Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Loveland, CO) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was an hour long, round-table setting with a four person panel. They took turns asking questions and after my answers there was often dialog that followed. It was fairly informal and comfortable. It didn't feel like you were in front of a firing squad but more like a chat with fellow professionals trying to gauge your experience and if you would be a good fit for the team.
Interview Questions: How would you handle the scenario of pile burning when you are the on-call burn boss and we are projected to get 2-3 inches of snow?

title: ESTÁGIO Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Rio de Janeiro)
Interview Descriptions: o processo seletivo foi simples e completo, rapido processo seletivo, apenas 2 entrevistas via Skype com diferentes membros da empresa. muito simpáticos e entrevista informal, oportunidade para fazer perguntas
Interview Questions: fale sobre vocês, quais seus interesses, porque a TNC

title: Conservation Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for an interview about five weeks after submitting the application. The interviewers were fine, but the questions they were asking did not really match the job description.
Interview Questions: What technologies do you use to stay organized?

title: Finance & Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (North Bethesda, MD)
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone conference interview scheduled with 2 individuals. Then I went in the office to interview. Odd- interviewed with 3 different people, all separately over the course of about an hour
Interview Questions: What would your co-workers say about you?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions:
There were three stages to the interview process: 

1st: Phone interview (group)
2nd: In-person interview (group)
3rd: Skype interview (one-on-one) 

You can tell this is a stellar team and everyone was very engaged during the interview. Plus, the HQ office is lovely - sporting landscape photography and a wall of live plants. Very cool!
Interview Questions:
The team asked great, poignant questions. Be prepared to answer several, "Tell me about a time when you...made a mistake...had to coordinate with lots of people....organize a project on your own...etc." questions.  

Also, there are plenty of standard questions you can prep for: Why do you want to work here? Why this role? Tell us about yourself. 

What's comforting is I felt I was able to prepare for these interviews by doing some well-rounded research regarding common interview questions.

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Very professional roundtable interview with 4 staff of different levels, two of which would be my direct reports. Only 1 round of interviews which was nice. Good questions about me and my background. Interview was onsite at their office in PA. Didn't get a lot of detail about the job however.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Pretty smooth and easy.  Applied online then waited for a response.  Had a phone interview and then went into office for interviews.  Met several people.  Had a call back 2 weeks later
Interview Questions: Hours that I was available

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted to fill out a brief questionnaire about 1-2 weeks later. Had a phone interview about a week later and then had an in-person interview at The Nature Conservancy a week after. The whole process took about 5 weeks.  Everyone who I spoke with was very friendly.
Interview Questions: Name an area that you feel you need more training/practice in and what have you already done to improve?

title: Development Projects Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Overall, a great experience. At first I had received an email saying I didn't get the job - this was a mistake and I was actually called for a phone interview 2 weeks later! A pleasant surprise... I spoke with two people on the team over the phone. My in-person interview was with one of the same women from the phone interview plus her supervisor, who is the team leader. I already had an offer on the table elsewhere at this point, and when I told them this they were able to fast-track the final interview, which was more of a meet and greet with the rest of the team that I hadn't met yet. It was more casual, off-site at a cafe near the office. Everyone had a chance to ask me questions, and I had the chance to ask everyone else questions, and it was really great. They offered me the job at the end of the week. The whole process took about 2 weeks from the phone interview (about 4 weeks from the time I submitted my application).
Interview Questions: What are you short-term and long-term career goals?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 phone interviews, 1 in-person individual interview, 2 face-to-face panel interviews, and 1 written test. I don't think the interviewers have communicated with one another internally because the questions were repeated from time to time. They were all skill-based questions. They also tried to understand my interest and working style through a few behavioral questions. All of the interviewers were really friendly and helpful. They were very willing to spend time to really explain to you about their jobs and the organization structure & culture. However, it seems that none of them had a good understanding about the role or its job responsibilities - I've heard inconsistent / conflicting answers and expectations from the hiring manager, the MD, and the various different colleagues who were supposed to work closely with the person. More importantly, the HR wasn't helpful - the selection process was unclear; there were a few last-minute interviews; even though I was one of the final two candidates, the HR never shared updates about the recruitment status or responded to my follow-up email afterwards. I rather receive a "yes" or "no" from them...
Interview Questions: Nothing was unexpected; all standard questions.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The overall process was poorly organized, with multiple last minute requests to be available to interview the following day, or, for example, receiving an email at 3PM on a Friday to notify me of a 9AM Monday interview.  For those currently employed, or with other responsibilities, that's not useful.  I had 4 separate 1:1 phone interviews with TNC staff from different programs; 1 phone based panel interview with 4 TNC staff, all senior level (e.g., state and continental director); and was asked to provide written responses to 5 questions within a 3 page limit.  Each of the single phone interviews focused on a specific skill area (communications/project management/collaboration) and situational responses to scenarios within those areas.  Some questions were very specific such as: "describe a process for optimally allocating finances across a network of partners, ' or "describe your approach to collaboration when you have no direct authority for any of the staff engaged." 

The panel interview was more broad,  covering personal traits/values, interest and commitment to conservation,  why was I the best choice,  and then some specific management Qs, such as: " how could you best demonstrate a return on investment to donors," or "what are specific challenges in evaluating a dispersed network of projects."  

I was given a few minutes at the end of each session to ask questions, and people were generally friendly throughout the process. I did receive conflicting information between TNC staff as to the nature of the position, and some seemed unclear how this position fit into the larger framework. That became an issue with the panel when something I was told by a junior level staff was contradicted by a senior level staff member. I also asked the panel about direct reporting lines as there seemed to be a range of people this position would report to based on statements they made, but received a vague response.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Volunteer Legal Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Washington, DC) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied through a job search website, and heard back after about 2 weeks. The interview was a basic phone interview, with relatively easy questions. Because I applied for the Latin American and Caribbean team, I had to speak to the interviewer in Spanish and Portuguese.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a time when you had to use problem-solving.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Washington, DC) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone screening followed by an in-person interview with five staff. After staff interview, there was a writing test where they asked me to write a letter to a prospective donor.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years, 10 years?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I actually applied months and months ago. Months later I received an email to provide more details. I reviewed and submitted all of the  required materials. I never heard back again. I followed-up (politely) just to ask if the position was filled. That's the correct and professional thing to do. I never heard a word back which, in my opinion, is unprofessional. I wasted a lot of time on this "interview project". I thought The Nature Conservancy would at least let me know one way or another.
Interview Questions: Typical questions: why do you want to work here, etc.

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Conshohocken, PA)
Interview Descriptions: After a 30 minute phone screening I was invited to interview with three different people on the hiring team. Mostly standard interview questions, plenty of opportunity to ask questions about the work and culture.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by two staffers at once.  Both worked for different departments of the Nature Conservancy and wanted to help assess the best placement for me as an intern.  They were both very nice and professional. I felt like they did a really good job in figuring out where to put me and preparing me for what to expect once I started the job.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with marine conservation?

title: Project Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Three sets of interviews. First one was short and with a Project Manager over the phone. Second one was in person with two full sets of hiring managers. Third one was with the Director. Interview process was good and the questions were straight-forward.  The in-person panels had less technical questions and more situational questions.
Interview Questions: What is something that people misunderstand about you?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Washing Tree)
Interview Descriptions: Video conference interview only. Video conference software worked very smoothly. No delay or static in the connection. Interviewer was prepared. Interview was with supervisor. No HR Pre-screening or phone call prior to the interview. Received a friendly email a few weeks later notifying me I would not be invited for further interviews, but invited me to apply again.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at The Nature Conservancy?

title: Conservation Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Phoneton, OH) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an online application and was contacted for a 30 minute phone screen. The next step was completing an assignment (paragraph responses to situational and other questions), followed by an interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current job?

title: Applied Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Santo Domingo) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied many months previous to when I was interviewed. That was the worst part, I didn't know I had been selected for the interview process. After that, it went pretty smoothly. I was interviewed through Skype once (for 1 hour).
Interview Questions: What makes you the best candidate for this position?

title: Preserve Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (West Palm Beach, FL) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview with one manager, which was my first 'red flag' that I wasn't a serious candidate.  The organization is a non-profit which relies heavily on donors, - for both volunteer time and monitory donations.
Interview Questions: Ten typical questions including tell me about a time that involved a confrontation with the public and how you handled it.

title: Paralegal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening before in-person interview. Skills test was included as part of in-person interview. One group of staff members did first portion of interview then another group came in for the second part.
Interview Questions: On a scale of 1-10, how detail orientated are you?

title: Stewardship Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: They interviewed over Skype for Business, and it's two to three people interviewing you at once, alternating who is asking the questions. This interview was with the Colorado chapter and I'm not sure if other chapters conduct their interviews in the same way. I have interviewed for them twice now, accepting the first offer for a seasonal position, and not receiving an offer for the second, although the processes were very similar.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the company?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Duluth, MN) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, got an email for an interview about a month later with the scientist I would work with. It was a brief 20-25 minute Skype interview followed by calls to all three references.
Interview Questions: Elaborate on your previous experience (mentioned in your resume).

title: Counsel Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Initial round was by Skype followed by a half day on in person interviews. Frustrating that the in person interviews all asked exactly the same questions. While I appreciate the goal of eliminating bias it produced a very superficial conversation and not sufficient opportunities to delve deeply into the job or by qualifications. 

The supervisor for the position was very brusque and explicitly said she waslooking for someone willing to put in long hours at the office (no telecommuting). By the end of the day I was no longer interested.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a challenge at your current job and how did you handle it.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a phone interview and scheduled a slot for about 2-3 weeks later. The phone interview lasted about 30 minutes, and included approximately 4 people that worked at that Nature Conservancy office on similar issues.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the Nature Conservancy?

title: Restoration Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Applied online via TNC website and phone interview to follow a few weeks later. Casual interview going through list of questions asking about education and experience with natural resource management.
Interview Questions: Experience in natural resource management

title: Donor Relations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied on-line, then received an email requesting a time for a phone Interview. Within two weeks I received an email offering dates for an in-person interview, which was several weeks in the future. Then in-person interview with a five-person panel. Very pleasant people.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation with a customer that you had to overcome.

title: Donor Relations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard and a positive process: phone interview, in person interview, references, job offer. Everyone was very kind. My in-person interview was two hours though. I was sure to bring knowledge of what the company is doing throughout the region and country.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: After filling out a breif questionnaire, I had a phone interview and a skype interview. Ultimately I was not offered the position, but my overall experience was good. Interviewers seemed pleased with their jobs and were not intimidating at all.
Interview Questions: Why this position?

title: Waste of Time Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Unethically long hiring process. Interviewers couldn't even answer simple questions such as "what is your company culture like?" or "around how many donors do you deal with?" They string you along with countless interviews with WAY too many people, only to ignore your calls for a week after a final decision was to be made. Extremely unprofessional and unorganized.
Interview Questions: What is your definition of  *job title applied for* ?

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: 1 phone interview with two people and 1 Skype interview with three people. Both were straight forward interviews. No trick questions. All the people I talked to were very nice. It seems like an awesome place to work. I was pretty bummed I didn't get the job. I would definitely apply with this organization again.
Interview Questions: Was there a time you had to handle a conflict with employees and how did you handle this situation?

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: The process lasted about 1.5 months. I have 2 phone interviews and a skype call. Everyone was very pleasant to speak to and even though I did not get the position they were very encouraging.
Interview Questions: They asked about my bottom-up management experience and style.

title: Administrative Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly standard. The employees at the company seemed very knowledgeable. I would encourage any future candidates to study the company and the position they are applying for well. The interviewers gave the impression that it is a very good company to work for.
Interview Questions: Standard questions, such as the candidates greatest strength and greatest weakness.

title: Protection Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: After a brief phone interview, I met with a team of folks who worked throughout the state. They were very friendly and invested resources and time in the interview process. It was helpful to visit the office and see the work environment, which was professional yet relaxed.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions focused on the specific job and my experience with similar projects. They also asked about my preference for project management software/tools.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was really nice, the questions were more behavioral. Interviewers were interested in someone who was passionate about nature and conservancy. The only thing is no one contacted me to let me know I didn't get the position. I had to email several times for status updates until they finally told me I didn't get it.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you were trying to reach out to another team, and they weren't responding? Marketing is not most teams highest priority, and they sometimes will not respond.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (New Haven, CT)
Interview Descriptions: 15 minutes pre-screening includes basic questions such as please introduce yourself, why TNC? Why this team? Why this position? What's is your visa status? Will you be willing to relocate to Colorado?. First round interview was 30-45 minutes including behavioral questions and a mini case. Second round would be a case that you need to send back a memo/financial models. Last round would be with a team director.
Interview Questions:
- What TNC?
- Why this team?
- Why this position?

title: Director Climate Change Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Made it to the third round interview. After that I was asked to do a writing sample. Did not get offered the job.  In general, the people were very friendly. They questions were relevant to the job. I was asked to do a writing sample immediately after the second interview before there was any deliberation, but then was declined after the writing sample. I did wish that they had deliberated after the interview when I was not present, and then asked for the sample as a next final stage. As it was, it felt like they were asking for too much at once when they could have made a cut and saved time of the people they were interviewing, and likely their own time as well. I do think TNC is a good organization doing good things.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with having five supervisors for this position?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (New York, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Group interview, mostly to see which candidates could actually live together for a month. Was actually pretty fun. Not all mentors were not present. Individual questions asked at the end of the group activities.
Interview Questions: What contributions can you make to a team?

title: GLOBE Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Washington, DC) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for an interview after submitting the online GLOBE internship application - which was a painful process because they asked for several essays and letters of recommendation. The interview was done by two managers of the particular internship position. It lasted for half an hour. My Skype went wrong at the beginning and it took us 5 minutes to solve the problem, which is probably why they rejected me in the end. I should have double checked to make sure the connection was fine.
Interview Questions: Tell us an example that shows your leadership

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Comprehensive with a panel and writing samples as well as one on one interviews with management.  Overall I thought they did a good job and It got at the key issues I was expecting
Interview Questions: What would your references say you were bad at?

title: Operations Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Email with simple 8Q questionnaire to fill out. Reply back in a couple days to schedule in person panel interview at HQ - Arlington. Interviewed with 3 people. No difficult questions. They each took turns but not in an organized manner. Emailed them back the next day and couple more times over the following month. They didn't have the common courtesy to reply back. They hired from within.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions. related to job description or resume

title: Philanthropy Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (San Francisco, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with someone who was not very good at selling the job. They seemed uninterested in their own position. The Interview was with 3 people in person and two people via Skype. Questions were generally behavioral in nature. Communication throughout this process was limited and very frustrating.
Interview Questions: Why the Nature Conservancy? Why this department?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application on the TNC website. A few days later I got an email asking to set up a phone interview. The phone interview was the following week. A few days after that, I got another email asking for references. I was offered the position a week or so after that.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for TNC?

title: Associate Director of Philanthropy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (San Francisco, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process was quite fast, they contacted me a couple of weeks after I applied to the position and arranged a phone interview. I didn't pass to the personal interview stage but honestly didn't understand the reason. They told me something about my experience that they must have noted since they first read it, so it was unsatisfying . The person in charge of the hiring process didn't show any passion or interest in their own job.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this role?

title: Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Reno, NV) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone interview a few weeks after applying. It was a moderately long interview with two people. Mostly tried to establish salary and hands-on conservation skills, though I'm still not sure what the job was since it sounded like a communications position from the job description. Most of the questions seemed to be based around a specific scenario, like other reviewers have mentioned it feels like a pop quiz, rather than an assessment of experience.
Interview Questions: How well do you know the following software/skills on scale to 1-5

title: Conservation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA)
Interview Descriptions: Began with a phone screening with the managing director, relatively lengthy discussion, then a large group interview.  Seemed to be way too many people on the interview panel, each with relatively similar perspectives...not much to justify the size.
Interview Questions:
Why did I think I was a good candidate?
Asked me questions in spanish to prove fluency.
Rate different conservation and development projects, explain what works in my opinion and what doesn't.
Thinking about potential sources and my experience with fundraising.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Posted job didn't match description of job once in the interview. I'm not sure they knew what they were interviewing for as it seemed to change each time I came in.  Incredibly long process due to staff schedules. Met with all levels of staff at different points in time - some in groups, some one-on-one.
Interview Questions: 3 people need the director's attention. How do you prioritize those needs?

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Tesuque, NM) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The opportunity was brought to my attention from an internal recruiter as a possible good match. The interview was scheduled as a phone group of 4 about 1 month after submission. It took about 55 minutes and was back-to-back with other candidates. Each participant had 1 question prepared and after answering all the questions, there was time for one question from me.
Interview Questions: What are the steps I'd take over the next 3-5 year period to develop the program.

title: Paralegal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: A week after I submitted the application, I got a call from a recruiter asking to set up a time for an interview. There was a panel of three interviewers who asked me typical interview questions. A week after the first interview, I got another email asking if I was available for a second interview.
Interview Questions: How would you handle working with a difficult person?

title: Science Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were very friendly. They seemed excited to speak to me. They carried on conservation that strayed away from the basic interview questions. After submitting a resume, I didn't receive a call to set up an interview until two months later.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions like tell me about yourself, what are your strengths, etc.

title: Director of Marketing and Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Baton Rouge, LA)
Interview Descriptions: Conducted two phone interviews with a national director for this regional position. Interviews were long and went well, but there was little interaction and the national director couldn't really describe the full scope of the position for which they were hiring.
Interview Questions: Can you provide metrics for marketing plans you've executed in the past?

title: Policy Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and immediately received an email for a phone interview. The interview itself was conducted by the hiring manager (and another individual who did not introduce themselves, even though I had no previous contact with them/had no idea who they were, their job title, or how they were related to the team). Weirdly, the hiring manager spoke maybe twice, while the other person (whom definitely was not an HR person) dominated the conversation. The interview consisted of what seemed to be a pop quiz on the subject matter, rather than anything about myself, my past experiences, or basically anything off of my resume/cover letter. Interviewer asked around four or five unrelated questions before giving me a chance to speak each time, as if they were extremely short on time and rushing through the interview. Finally, they stated they would get back to me either way by the end of the week and conduct in-person interviews the following week. Sent a thank you note and received no response. No response by the end of the week. No response the following week. Sent another email that week inquiring whether the position was filled. No response! Not only is this unprofessional, but it is extremely rude and devalues a person who has spent time and effort in applying to a job, prepping for an interview, etc.
Interview Questions: Four-part hypothetical technical questions that tested knowledge on the subject

title: Philanthropy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Morgantown, WV) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was thorough and enjoyable. They did a phone interview first, clearly poked around on my social media, & then an in-person interview. The questions ranged from how I'd use my skill set in the new position to how long I hoped to work for them, which was a strange question. They were a pleasant group and clearly knew what they wanted out of the hire which has always been a good thing for me.
Interview Questions: How will adapt to leaving out-the-door fundraising?

title: LEAF Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (New Brunswick, NJ) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is extensive. They want to see how well you can handle the unexpected. They also want to know how well you work with others especially working in the outdoors. They really love people with teaching experience so it helps if you're a teacher. They want to know that you can think for yourself, separate yourself from family and friends to work with young people.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your interest.

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in the fall and received only an automatic acknowledgement of my application.  I did not hear anything and assumed that it was a dead-end until I received an email request for a phone interview in February with the person to whom you'd report. The phone interview was one of an undisclosed number to determine call backs for in person interviews.  I was under the impression that I would be called back for an on-site interview, but it would have been a switch to working for a non-profit entity, and a salary reduction, which was discussed as a concern (of theirs).   I did, after several weeks, receive a very nice personal email thanking me for my interest and wishing me well in my job search--it mentioned salary as a factor.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in switchng to the non-profit world?

title: Operations Assistant - Atlanta Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Extremely lengthy - more than two months from applying to interview. After initial phone interview I was invited to meet with a panel of four. The interview lasted about 45 minutes with a number of typical situational questions. I asked when a decision would be made and was informed interviews would be occurring the following week as well. Was called in a couple of days informing me another candidate was selected.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a board member you did not get along with, or had upset?

title: Intern - Monthly Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Intern was really informal. Consisted of a Skype call with Senior Advisor who just asked me questions about my interests as well as logistics of the internship. They needed an all-around support intern so there really weren't many requirements. This interview came about through a family-friend referral, so I didn't formally apply.
Interview Questions:
-What are you interested in doing?
-Are you interested in the work we do? Why?

title: Philanthropy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Applied to a job posting on their website and was called for an interview about three weeks later. 

Met with two directors of the office I was applying to for an hour. The interview was straightforward--"tell me about yourself," "why do you want to work here," etc.--with a few behavioral questions towards the end. Overall it was a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: None were necessarily difficult. Strengths, weaknesses, etc. Simply come prepared with examples of times you handled different work situations--"when was a time you successfully resolved an issue in an office?"

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process through my university. Not through the nature conservancy. Worked not at HQ. Individualized through a program. Was not too difficult, was competing with other local candidates. Could have been more difficult for a full time job position.
Interview Questions: Research goals were vague

title: Wetland Restoration Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I received a call to schedule an interview a few days after the closing date.  Prior to the interview, they sent me an e-mail to let me know who I was meeting with and other pertinent information.  The interview was conducted by a panel of four people, all of whom I would work with directly. A glass of water was also provided without my asking, which I thought was considerate.  The panel took turns asking me questions and they all recorded my answers.  At the end, I learned that this was just a first interview and that further steps included a writing assessment and a second interview. I thought the interview went very well but in the end they decided to go with someone else.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were technical in nature although some behavioral based questions were also asked.  While I didn't find any of them difficult to answer, it was hard to keep up with the number of questions they asked at one time.  It would have been nice to have a copy of the questions during the interview so that I could follow along.

title: Policy Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: It was a single in-person interview with the person who would be my direct supervisor and another associate. All of the questions were either directly related to the job description, my experience, or my career ambitions. There were no 'zingers'.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5-10 years?

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview to begin with and then waited a week and a half to hear back for an in person interview which was conducted by 2 interviewers. Then I got called back in for a third interview a week later which was a panel interview of 4 people. A few days later I accepted an offer. The interview experience was fantastic...I never felt so comfortable in an interview(s). A phenomenal organization overall!!
Interview Questions: Basic situational questions that you learn about in college. The latter interviews are clearly more personality based where they see whether you will be a good fit.

title: Philanthropy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, and had two interviews by telephone. Very friendly interviews, with a lot of information provided by both interviewers on the details of the specific position I applied for and the area of the organization I'd be working in - how it fit with the organization's activities. I really appreciated the detail given because it helped me feel confident about the process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Field Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: Excellent outreach to me as a candidate.  Clear explanation of online application requirements.  Reasonable amount of time to notify me of hiring results.
Interview Questions: None.  The hiring process was very straightforward with all questions relating to the information I submit about my prior experience.

title: Project Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening then two in-office screening - very nice people, quite basic questions. Having concrete examples ready is good.  Very nice office.  The interview was a 3-person panel where they took turns asking questions.  Classic interview questions.
Interview Questions: "Tell me about a time when you successfully improved an operating system."

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Peoria, IL) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Relatively easy process. Background check required, though no drug test, so it was a pretty quick hiring process. Interviewers were very nice, answered all questions and were always professional and helpful.
Interview Questions: No really unexpected questions- typical "what are your skills", "what do you bring to the table", etc.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (New York, NY) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: there was just one call with my future boss, very casual and informative. it was an unpaid internship so very little information was needed in the interview process. I had a family friend who referred me, making the process a lot easier
Interview Questions: no difficult questions

title: Global PR Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview with the HR associate.  Very professional, organized lady with good questions about my past experiences and capabilities.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of the ordinary.  Very professional.

title: Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy
Interview Descriptions: It was a very lengthy and detailed interview process with one panel interview and several one-on-ones. As far as I know, all references and prior employers were contacted.  The questions were the type of interview questions you learn about in college - e.g. tell me about a time when you made a mistake and how you handled it?
Interview Questions: Sometimes we must make difficult decisions regarding wildlife when we purchase and maintain land. For instance, we purchased a track of land in HI that had been overrun by non-native boar. In order to maintain the land, we had to go in and kill the boar. Would you have a problem when this type of decision has to be made?

title: Regional Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Bogotá, Bogota) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: A headhunter called me and he made a whole interview by phone.
Interview Questions: They asked me and three different languages (Spanish, English, Portuguese) Three different questions.

title: River Basin Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Nashville, TN) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Round table interview with 6 people asking different questions from ecological experience, educational outreach, philanthropically driven experience, coalition building, etc. Explain your ecological restoration experience in relation to first order streams, corridor functioning, etc. It was a very good atmosphere in the room, and everyone was very friendly. It was a good interviewing experience.
Interview Questions: How would you proceed with an ecological restoration project (similar type question)?

title: Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Washington, DC) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Friendly conversation, phone and in person interviews, panel interviews and examples needed. Looked to be hiring on personality as well as skills. Very professional and up front about job requirements. Non-profit experience not required, but helpful. Looks like they have good work/life balance. Salary range was decent for a non-profit.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Preserve Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submit resume and cover letter.  I then secured a phone interview that lasted for about an hour.  I believe that I was merely interviewed since they needed to interview several folks to comply with the equal opportunity obligation.  The supervisor actually became hostile to me during the 4 person review panel and I had to feign a submissive attitude.  It was a very awkward interview even though I was well prepared.
Interview Questions: Please Explain a situation where you identified a problem and came up with a solution.

title: Several Jobs Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: First job answered an ad in the newspaper. Subsequent jobs applied internally via the HR intranet. Usually 2 to 3 interviews until you get the job offer. They do check on your references, and if you are in the company they give priority to internal employees. They have the basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job? How long have you been at your position? Do you have skills that match the position?

title: Associate Director of Philanthropy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview, 1st Round Panel Interview, 2nd Round Panel Interview, Board Interview.  Each round was with a different group of individuals.  The questions tended to be the same type of questions with each round, leading me to believe that there was not much coordination with the individuals involved.  Seemed to be more of a fit analysis.  References were checked.
Interview Questions: Please describe in detail your experience in fundraising.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Washington, DC) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Well design, excellent questions, treated very well throughout.  HR profession running the recruitment was excellent. Hiring manager was professional at all times: asked tough questions and was very straight foward about the whole process
Interview Questions: Greatest accomplishment?

title: Executive Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Lansing, MI) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: one phone interview, followed by two in-person interviews; three "homework" assignments
Interview Questions: What are your greatest weaknesses as an employee

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process is very long.  After a phone interview, I interviewed with two different teams of multiple people each, weeks apart.  I was asked many questions phrased as describe a time when you....

 In the end, the hiring manager re-posted the job.  Although there were other jobs there that interested me, the time it took to go through the interview process was too long for me to pursue them.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you were on a project that was over budget.  How did you handle it?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Arlington, VA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Graduate school was notified of positions. Sent resume and cover letter and then received a phone interview. I interviewed with the hiring manager and the HR staff member. It was a very simple process, l likely because it was for a short term internship. Advice to applicant: know the subject matter and the issues that The Nature Conservancy cares about. For a non-profit it has a culture that is quite corporate.
Interview Questions: Question very specific to the issues/topics the internship was covering.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: pretty straight forward; the first phase was a short 30 minute phone interview to guage your pulse; second interview was inhouse and consisted of a panel of four people who alternated asking questions. the depth of questioning was surprising and i was not as prepared as i needed to be; i was not surprised when the offer did not follow the interview
Interview Questions: how would you reengineer this product (simple children's toy)?

title: Senior Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2008
Interview Descriptions: I was flown in and given a hotel for one night. I gave a scientific presentation relating my work to conservation issues. Then I had two panel interviews consisting of the management at that particular office. The questions were not unusual for a science-based position, but I had to justify how my reserach experience would help in a conservation context. I had prepared using the book "the 60 Second Sell", and it helped.
Interview Questions: Without direct conservation experience, how are you able to do the job?

title: Freshwater Biologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Nature Conservancy (Harrisburg, PA) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: The interview was more technical than other interviews I've been on. The hiring manager and panel were relaxed and friendly, making the interview a comfortable and positive experience. The experience questions were typical of others I've seen, but any candidate not prepared to discuss detailed biological principals and concepts will be caught off guard. I did well in the interview. However, my salary history eliminated me from consideration. The Nature Conservancy is a non-profit and the salaries reflect that.
Interview Questions: Describe the most pressing negative environmental impact affecting freshwater ecosystems to date and if faced tackling this issue in a given setting, describe the strategy you would implement.
